intro: Pteronia marginata, commonly known as the Cape marguerite, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils and coastal conditions. It produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its propagation. Pteronia marginata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
